instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> intermittent ssd not detected.
threads.message:
Hi, this board came in with folder ? 
disk utility doesnt show internal ssd,but sometimes laptop will boot.
i heard bad <CHIP>U9300</CHIP>, low battery will cause no ssd, but i charge it fully, still folder ?
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_SSD_HOT</SIGNAL> 1.2v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_SSD</SIGNAL> 3.3v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_2V7_NAND_VCC</SIGNAL> = 2.67v
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_SSD_COLD</SIGNAL> 1.8v
<SIGNAL>PP2V7_NAND_PVCC</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP2V7_NAND_VCC</SIGNAL> is 5v.
any pointer ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> intermittent ssd not detected.
threads.message:
Clean J9600 contacts first.
Check signals level at pins 12 & 14.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> intermittent ssd not detected.
threads.message:
j9600 cleaned: 
pin12 not stable, cycling around 2,6v to 1.3v to 0.4v,and back to 2.6v
pin 14 : cycling from 1.3v to 0.4v, back to 1.3v again.
still folder ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> intermittent ssd not detected.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> intermittent ssd not detected.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> intermittent ssd not detected.
threads.message:
another lifeboat connector doesnt help.

im making measurement with lifeboat connector off btw.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> intermittent ssd not detected.
threads.message: Wait, you've checked SSD voltages without lifeboat connected???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> intermittent ssd not detected.
threads.message: for the lifeboat connector voltage yeah, i dont use the lifeboat. ok i will redo measurement

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> intermittent ssd not detected.
threads.message:
11 3.08v
12 3.1v
13 90mv
14 91mv
i would sayvoltage looks good.
should i replace picolo ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> intermittent ssd not detected.
threads.message:
What about L9300/20 voltages?
Also check pins 4/6/8 of J9600.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> intermittent ssd not detected.
threads.message:
l9300 and l9320 both at 0.9v
j6900 pin 4 1.7v
6 100mv
8 3.2v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> intermittent ssd not detected.
threads.message: can i swap the ssd controller, rom and etc ? in case data isnt a problem ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> intermittent ssd not detected.
threads.message:
BGA chips in SSD area are usually underfilled and the controller sandwich type.
Pretty hopeless project...
